segments.text: I notice the boy standing on that stool, stretching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is just waiting, like she’s done this before.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and the woman is just standing there, drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip, and he doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside is so calm, but in here, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long this has been going on before someone reacts.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s hand is open, waiting for her cookie, like this is all normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone is going to get hurt if this keeps up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s focus is entirely on that plate, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR
